subject: Re: [junit] swing
msgSnippet: Hi! My be you need  to write the test class like this. class Testmyclass extends TestCase { public Testmyclass( final String name ) { super( name ); } public
messageBody:
Hi!

My be you need to write the test class like this.

class Testmyclass extends TestCase
{
public Testmyclass( final String name )
{
super( name );
}

public void testClickMe() throws Exception
{
final JFCTestHelper helper = new JFCTestHelper();

... //showing/creating of the windows is missing here.. may
be you need to call some myclass methods which renders the window first.
final JButton
clickme=(JButton)helper.findNamedComponent(myclass.class,"mybutton",0);
assertNotNull("ClickMe Button not found ", clickme);
flushAWT();
}
}

Try not using object vairables in test classes. Try to put the full test
logic in test methods rather scattered accross setUp() , testXX() and
tearDown() methods. Also try using new NamedComponentFinder(compCls,
name).find(index); insted of findNamedComponent as this is deprecated.
Another important thing is you need to show the window before you could
start using the findNamedComponent


http://jfcunit.sourceforge.net/api/junit/extensions/jfcunit/TestHelper.html#findNamedComponent(java.lang.Class,
java.lang.String, int)

Regards,
Nagendra
